Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: It is concluded that intragastric pressure increases significantly during muscle fasciculations caused by suxamethonium in healthy children .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| muscle fasciculations |

Note: I have identified "muscle fasciculations" as a disease entity in the paragraph. Fasciculations refer to sudden, involuntary muscle twitches, which can be a symptom of various neuromuscular disorders. However, in this context, it is not explicitly stated that the muscle fasciculations are a disease or a disorder, but it is mentioned as an observable phenomenon caused by suxamethonium in healthy children. Nonetheless, I have included it as a disease entity for the sake of comprehensiveness.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| muscle fasciculations |

Note: I have reviewed the paragraph again, and I confirm that "muscle fasciculations" is the only entity that can be classified as a disease or disorder. The other entities in the paragraph, such as "intragastric pressure" and "suxamethonium," are not diseases.

The entity "suxamethonium" is the only chemical mentioned in the paragraph. It is a neuromuscular blocking agent used in anesthesia to induce paralysis.
